author: Michael Larabel
description: Alex Gaynor recently announced he is formally stepping down as one of the maintainers of the Rust for Linux kernel code with the removal patch now queued for merging in Linux 6.19...
title: Rust For Linux Kernel Co-Maintainer Formally Steps Down

author: Michael Larabel
description: Building off the release of Red Hat Enterprise Linux 10.1 from two weeks ago, AlmaLinux 10.1 is now available in GA form for this community-oriented RHEL10 downstream. Making AlmaLinux 10.1 all the more interesting is the project's decision to promote Btrfs file-system support...
title: AlmaLinux 10.1 Released - Complete With Btrfs Support

author: Michael Larabel
description: A year and a half after the Linux kernel patches were first posted, SDCIAE that is found with AMD Zen 5 server processors is set to finally be supported by the mainline kernel come Linux 6.19...
title: AMD SDCIAE Working Its Way Into The Linux 6.19 Kernel

author: Michael Larabel
description: A set of patches implementing async I/O IOCB_NOWAIT support for the loop block device is heading to the Linux 6.19 kernel with some performance improvements that will make loop block device users "wow"...
title: A Very Big Performance Optimization For Loop Block Devices Heading To Linux 6.19

author: Michael Larabel
description: In addition to debuting the Raspberry Pi OS Imager 2.0 app, Raspberry Pi today announced the latest version of their operating system...
title: Raspberry Pi OS 2025-11-24 Brings HiDPI Improvements, Wayland Enhancements

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Raspberry Pi Imager application that makes it easy to generate install media / OS image flashing for different Raspberry Pi devices is out with a big feature update...
title: Raspberry Pi Imager 2.0 Released To Make It Easier Creating OS Media

author: Michael Larabel
description: The upcoming Linux 6.19 kernel cycle is set to introduce initial support for Xe3P graphics to be found initially with Nova Lake processors. While that initial support is landing for Linux 6.19, other extra Xe3P features are still to be added to the open-source kernel driver over coming release cycles. One of those extra features being currently tackled is a new element with Xe3P_LPD: the ability to use the system cache for FBC...
title: Intel Working On Linux Support For New Power Savings Feature With Xe3P_LPD

author: Michael Larabel
description: Canonical and AMI announced a partnership today so that there will be an Ubuntu Metbookt option added within AMI's UEFI firmware to allow booting to the Ubuntu installer without the need for even having any install media...
title: Canonical Partners With AMI To Build Ubuntu Netboot Option Into UEFI Firmware

author: Michael Larabel
description: The end of 2025 is quickly approaching and while there are the various end of year holidays, you can still expect to find new and original content on Phoronix each and every single day of the year just as it's been for more than a decade of the now 21-year-old Phoronix.com. The last day without any new content on Phoronix was all the way back in May of 2012. That's due to my passion for Linux hardware and open-source, paired in more recent years with the more grueling environment to make ends meet with the ever increasing state of the web advertising industry, rampant ad-block use, and related challenges for web publishers. If you would like to show your support for Phoronix's Linux hardware content over the past two decades, this week is the "Cyber Week" / "Black Friday" sale to go ad-free, multi-page-articles on a single page, and other benefits at a reduced rate...
title: Phoronix Premium Cyber Week "Black Friday" Deal To Help Enable Linux Hardware Reviews

author: Michael Larabel
description: Since the 2022 release of memtest86+ 6.0 as a rewrite of this long-used RAM testing utility, this open-source software has continued advancing nicely after a decade hiatus. Released on Sunday night was memtest86+ 8.0 as the latest iteration of this popular RAM tester for enthusiasts...
title: Memtest86+ 8.0 Released With Support For Latest Intel & AMD CPUs
